title: @Rioters; I have to question your decision making on these latest Harrowing Skins.
body:
This is mainly towards the "Slayer" {{champion:222}}  and {{champion:80}} . Because anyone can look/dress up like a Vandilizer, Punk-biker style individual for Halloween, but these skins dont exactly scream...Harrowing Skins. Honestly, Pantheon already got a pretty solid Dragon SLAYER Skin 5 months ago and Jinx just got her Lunar Revel Skin maybe 7 months ago? Hers respectfully worth 1350 RP while Pantheons is worth 975 RP(subject to change). Who makes the final ruling on whats considered for the Harrowing?

Dont get me wrong on the Zombie {{champion:20}} Skin because thats a great Harrowing themed Skin. Its just disappointing to see skins for the Harrowing this year used up on 2 champions who just this year got solid looking skins. I feel the creative skin designe team could have and still CAN do better than this imo.

replies.body: Jinx and Pantheon's skins could come out at any time during the year and it wouldn't be weird.
Riot forgot that {{champion:127}} {{champion:268}}  are great harrowing theme + they both didnt get new skins for far more than a year
Necromancer Azir, brings up zombie soldiers.

God damn it, Lissandra is literally a witch, would have been a great space for a halloween skin...

Maybe next year :^)

Hey Sinspunch,

*(Sorry for a bit of copy paste here)*

As [we've mentioned](http://boards.pbe.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/general-pbe-feedback/vg5QEGPB-pbe-bugs-feedback-thread-slayer-pantheon?comment=00010000) in one of the PBE posts, we're doing things a bit differently this year. We'll be posting an announcement soon that should clear up some things. :]

> Who makes the final ruling on whats considered for the Harrowing?

When coming up with new skin ideas, whether it's for a group of skins, or a one off, we work together a as a team to ideate and come up with possible skin ideas. We'll then narrow down our choices and work together to agree upon a final concept, which is then modeled, animated, etc., and then shot out to PBE for player feedback.

While the time since last skin is taken into consideration, it's not the final call as to if we will/won't create a skin. For Pantheon and Jinx, we felt they were good candidates for 'zombie slayers', which is why they were the final choices.

At least, where is Shadow Isles event that you promised in this month?
Uh,she's on the skins team.There's still likely a Shadow Isle event on the lore side.The skins team is probably doing their own thing for Harrowing.
Well, it looks like the player feedback in the lol boards environment is against the idea thus far.

We've been looking at feedback from several social media platforms - LoL Boards, Reddit, Twitter, YouTube, S@20, etc. The feedback hasn't been as negative as I think you're implying. While some may not like all of the skins, mains of Jinx, Nunu and Patheon have been giving mostly positive feedback. That said, we're still on the look out and open to feedback for these skins! 

We'll be posting some messaging around these skins soon, which should clarify the changes we made for this year's skins.
I play a lot of Jinx, like the new skin, and still think this was a terrible choice
Would you mind elaborating a bit more on why you dislike it?

My only problem is zombies aren't a halloween thing anymore. People associate them with the Walking Dead/apocolypse/disease thing/plants vs. Zombies, and not the undead rising from the grave when "x" condition is right. This makes Jinx and Pantheon feel more like a post apocalyptic survivor group and less like a once in a lifetime evil slayer. That's all well and good, but I think for the Harrowing, people want the stereotypical ghost, zombies, monsters, and spooky skeletons. Even if there's an in lore fun zombie killing thing happening, it's not like lore-wise, pantheon would need any better weaponry to kill them than he already has.

I do think any real backlash about it is ridiculous, but overall, I see 1 amazing, probably the best Harrowing skin ever (unfortunately for an off-meta pick, which is worse than just being bad), and 2 skins that took the place of a potential Harrowing skin.

Again, I'm not TOO disappointed, as 2 of the 3 skins coming out in 5.20 are more Harrowing skins than the ones last year.

EDIT: Thanks for all the comments though! :D

Thanks for the feedback! 

> That's all well and good, but I think for the Harrowing, people want the stereotypical ghost, zombies, monsters, and spooky skeletons. 

In terms of this, we're actually switching up how we do things, which is why these skins may feel a bit different than skins you've seen in previous years. For a bit more info, check out [this post](http://boards.pbe.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/general-pbe-feedback/Grefbrd1-a-note-about-the-harrowing) regarding some of the changes we're making around the Harrowing, Snowdown, etc.

...That doesn't explain anything.

It just says 'we're not releasing all of the harrowing stuff all at once anymore'.

That has nothing to do with the complaints I've been hearing.

Maybe it means there's going to be more skins when harrowing is over?

I don't know
Jinx, Pantheon and Nunu are the only skins that will be coming out for this particular event.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot KateyKhaos,realm=NA,application-id=A8FQeEA8,discussion-id=EOtjEGZo,comment-id=0004000200000000000000060000000000000000,timestamp=2015-10-14T22:32:26.487+0000)
>
> Jinx, Pantheon and Nunu are the only skins that will be coming out for this particular event.

That is so royally disappointing :(

>Hey everyone,

>We’re making a few changes around how we roll out seasonal events, story, and featured game modes. As you know, in past seasonal events we’ve released content together (i.e. the Harrowing or Snowdown). Going forward, we’re going to be switching that up a bit and releasing those different types of content separately — like you’ve probably seen on PBE with One For All, Zombie / Slayer skins, and the Shadow Isles champion bios. All of this means seasonal events like the Harrowing and Snowdown will roll out differently than you’ve seen them in the past. This lets us kick out cool stuff more often without being constrained by specific times of year.

>As always, let us know what you think about these changes in the comments below. We’re stoked to hear what you think.

Are you telling me that his ^ doesn't answer anything? I mean you would be correct, it doesn't. Just asking.

And I love that this is on the PBE. So unless you have a PBE key you can't respond or express ideas/thoughts about it.
Yes, that does not answer any of the complaints I've been hearing. It has nothing to do with the kind of skins being released, and everything to do with the timetable they get released in.

I already feel quite satisfied with Jinx's current selection of skins.  I /do/ like this skin but I feel like it could have been given to her at any time in the future like you say, and somebody else could have gotten a cooler Halloween skin.  This is the only time every year that certain skin thematics can be done, like with Snowdown too.

I also think that with the release of Kindred, there should have been an event surrounding her
I like it, but why in the world is it not "Riot Girl Jinx"? Because the only "Zombie Slayer" aspect of the skin is her recall animation, but all of her visuals scream "Riot Girl".

I'm not a fan myself because Pantheon has so many skins already. Jinx is relatively new but that's her second new skin _this year._

What about Sion, or Urgot, or Yorick? What about Diana or Jarvan or Karthus? What about Swain or Kennen? There are so many champs you guys could be making skins for, but you're choosing newer champions that have already had attention, like Jinx, or that have plenty of skins already, like Pantheon.

You guys don't ever seem to look at what champions are more in need of skins. It doesn't seem to matter that some champions haven't had a new skin since _2011._ And that bothers me a great deal. I hate seeing that kind of favoritism.

Thanks for your reply Katey! I always appreciate when Riot addresses potentially uncomfortable topics like this (e.g. original Lux). 

It does trouble me that you seem to be discounting just how negative the response has been to these skins though. I've been browsing all of the above mentioned sites (except twitter) and I've seen nearly unanimous disappointment. I have seen the occasional "I main Jinx, so I'll buy it" comments, but I've even seen very well thought out posts by Pantheon and Jinx mains speaking to why these skins miss the mark for them. This is especially true of Jinx, who already has an anarchic theme, so Slayer just takes that trope to the extreme. Could you perhaps let us know if you plan on releasing any additional skins this Harrowing, perhaps to tie in with the oncoming lore event?

Also, I'm interested if you could speak to why the number of holiday skins has decreased dramatically since 2012. When other patches that come out throughout the year can have 4-6 skins, it seems strange to limit the amount of skins for fan-favorite events like the Harrowing and Snowdown to 2/3.

No worries, always glad to explain things where I can. ^-^ 

I'm sorry if it comes off that I'm discounting the negative response, that's certainly not my intent. When we're looking at the feedback, we take a look at which feedback is upset about the change in thematic, and which feedback is actionable, constructive feedback on the skins itself. 

I agree - there has been some negative feedback, and it's been in discussion with some positive feedback. We're still in the process of digesting everything since the skins just hit PBE yesterday. 

We won't be releasing additional skins - just Slayer Jinx, Zombie Nunu and Slayer Pantheon. 

> Also, I'm interested if you could speak to why the number of holiday skins has decreased dramatically since 2012. When other patches that come out throughout the year can have 4-6 skins, it seems strange to limit the amount of skins for fan-favorite events like the Harrowing and Snowdown to 2/3.

We don't have a set number of skins for each event, it's a matter of what kind of theme we're going with, who fits it and what the skins are going to need. If we want to do some skins where we change everything - particles, sounds, animations, etc., we'll likely have a lower number of skins, as opposed to if we just did some model changes.  Rather than rushing 6 skins, we'd rather spend the time and create quality skins, even if that means a couple less skins for x event.

I'm glad you guys are looking at feedback. It's definitely promising that you guys check lots of different sources too, and it's a good idea to give it some more time to see the overall response. I'm curious, do you guys do much survey-based research? As a market research professional, I'd love to know how that kind of data informs the decisions of the skins team! 

I definitely understand that it must take a ton of work for these events, so the limited resources would definitely play a factor in limiting the number of skins. But with that in mind, was 2012 just a very special Harrowing? Not only did you guys release Elise and the brand new Twisted Treeline map, you also released 6 amazing skins, one of which was legendary. I believe 4 of the 6 skins had new particles, sounds, and animations, while Zombie Brand had a completely new VO. To this day, I think that event released the best skins for Hecarim, Maokai, and Brand. 

That year, the Harrowing felt absolutely magical. All that hard work paid off tremendously. The theme was SO solid, yet there was still a nice blend of Halloween tropes, champs in costume, and Harrowing references. I think it nailed what a lot of people love about these seasonal events. If the resources for all of that were available back then, I hope that one day, the 2012 Harrowing can be the gold standard for future Harrowings going forward.

> I'm glad you guys are looking at feedback. It's definitely promising that you guys check lots of different sources too, and it's a good idea to give it some more time to see the overall response. I'm curious, do you guys do much survey-based research? As a market research professional, I'd love to know how that kind of data informs the decisions of the skins team!

We do have survey research! You or a friend may have seen a survey pop up at the end of a game. I personally received one after purchasing DJ Sona asking how satisfied I was with the purchase, and what I thought of the skin. We do various surveys that span a wide range of topics. These surveys can help identify what players really enjoy, what we can do better, and help improve skin decisions in the future. 

> I definitely understand that it must take a ton of work for these events, so the limited resources would definitely play a factor in limiting the number of skins. But with that in mind, was 2012 just a very special Harrowing? Not only did you guys release Elise and the brand new Twisted Treeline map, you also released 6 amazing skins, one of which was legendary. I believe 4 of the 6 skins had new particles, sounds, and animations, while Zombie Brand had a completely new VO. To this day, I think that event released the best skins for Hecarim, Maokai, and Brand.

I can't speak too much to that, as I began working at Riot last year, and the 2012 Harrowing event wasn't something I have much context for. Looking at the line up for that year, those skins don't have all the bells and whistles that the skins this year have. 1350s, legendaries a couple years ago aren't on the same bar as the content we're putting out in 2015. As I've mentioned we're always looking to improve the content we produce, which sometimes mean quality over quantity. 

> That year, the Harrowing felt absolutely magical. All that hard work paid off tremendously. The theme was SO solid, yet there was still a nice blend of Halloween tropes, champs in costume, and Harrowing references. I think it nailed what a lot of people love about these seasonal events. If the resources for all of that were available back then, I hope that one day, the 2012 Harrowing can be the gold standard for future Harrowings going forward.

We're looking into changing how the Harrowing, Snowdown, etc. will be as we move forward. We just posted [this](http://boards.pbe.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/general-pbe-feedback/Grefbrd1-a-note-about-the-harrowing) which gives a bit of additional context. Thoughts are welcome!

If thoughts are welcome here are mine:

I highly dislike changing how events are handled going forward. Releasing cohesive, lore-driven events that include game modes, map skins, champ skins, lore stories makes far more sense then releasing random game modes, random skins, etc that don't feel like they are a part of the event. Releasing Twister Treeline made sense as a part of Harrowing. Releasing Underworld Wukong, Ravenborn Leblanc that mimicked the style of Shadow Isles champs made sense as a part of Harrowing. Releasing Zombie Brand, Zombie Ryze, and Zombie Nunu makes sense as a part of Harrowing. Releasing Zombie Slayer skins that could have been released at any time of the year as apocolyptic skins without any negative comment does not. Releasing One for All, a mode unconnected with Harrowing when other old gameplay modes, like Doombots perhaps, that have a spooky theme are available doesn't make sense either.

Claiming that "this will allow Riot more freedom to act without constraints" as the Rioter does in that follow up post is flat out laughable. This is the exact same claim Riot made when the decision to burn down the lore was made and *not a single lore event since then has been made that couldn't have occurred in the realm of old lore*. It's patronizing.

I'd like to get one of those surveys. I'd like to explain how much of a chore and an unenjoyable pain Ranked has become for me since the poor balance decisions surrounding  Juggurnauts. I made Plat this season and didn't enjoy it at all. I'd like to explain how much I dislike the way Champ Up seems like a complete toss up as to whether a favorite champ's identity and gameplay will be ripped up and tossed out by a developer that thinks they know better. I'd like to explain how it feels like Riot plays favorites in balance and skin release, while some champs languish for years that Riot doesn't have stated plans to change kit or model. I'd like to explain how I don't trust Riot enough to buy things from them with real money since the Gangolank debacle. But I guess these surveys don't come out a lot.

As I'd mentioned in your other thread - thanks for taking the time to voice your opinion. 

This is a change that I think worries players since it's something different than we've done in the past. I think it'll make a bit more sense as events start to roll out, and you'll see that it's not as bad as it may be coming off. Part of why we're a bit vague on the subject is because we're still planning some of the later stuff, but trust me, it'll still be cool, just different. *This is just my two cents on the subject!* I do understand the frustrations you've mentioned above - game modes, lore, etc that were tied in previous Harrowing events. I'd ask you give this a chance, and if you'd like, drop me a line once this particular events rolls out - I'd love to see how you feel after the event happens. :] 

I handle the skins portion of this, so I can't speak to the events that have tied into Harrowing, Snowdown, etc in the past. Speaking from the skins standpoint - the majority of skins that we create aren't lore-driven and that's by design. We don't want to limit our skins based on who a champion is. By doing that, it gives us a chance to make Sivir good (Warden Sivir), or make Lux a Star Guardian. 

That said, for something like Burning Tides, we did create some lore-based skins, but that was tied into the huge event that rolled out. I understand lore is a touchy subject, and I don't have enough subject matter expertise to speak on behalf of it. *(Not trying to avoid the feedback you've given, I just don't know enough about what's going on with their side of things.*

We do surveys pretty frequently on a wide range of topics, but I'm not sure the exact reach we aim for. It seems like you have a lot of feedback you'd like to give, and I'd suggest making posts on the board regarding things like gameplay changes, or Champion Updates. While we may not respond to every post (we're usually pretty busy, especially around this time of year), many Rioter lurk and grab feedback. If you don't have a PBE account, feel free to leave feedback on the live board pertaining to the changes happening on PBE - it's always welcome, and speaking personally, there's a ton of great feedback left for skins on the live boards each cycle. 

On a lighter note, congrats on reaching Plat, although I'm sorry it wasn't the best experience getting there. D:

Again, thanks for the feedback. I'd love to see more posts regarding the points you've made above!

'Don't worry it'll make sense later.'

Said the lore team. Said the champion update team. Said the live balance team.

It's later.

It still doesn't make sense.

I'm not exactly believing you.
It doesn't give me any joy to say any of it and believe me it depresses me too. I used to enjoy this game a lot more. I'd like to again.

Not saying I don't like the skins, but saying 
> mains of Jinx, Nunu and Patheon have been giving mostly positive feedback

Is like asking a greedy dude if he likes food. Of course he does, he's greedy. 
So obviously you're gonna get positive feedback from the people who like those champions and main them. Talk about circle jerk.
I'm a jinx main and have hated every skin that has come out for her.
What thematic for her are you looking for?

Actually, Slayer is the first Jinx skin I really like.
I think that it's about that I didn't feel her classic craziness in her skins until Slayer Jinx. For some reason it just feels crazy like the classic skin- I suppose that it has to do with how she still wears the sort-of punk clothes and simply wants to blow up zombies.
I'm not sure what _I_ want to see from another Jinx skin. I don't want the "she must _feel_ crazy" thing I have when it comes to Jinx skins to limit you guys when you make more skins for her. Maybe something in a completely different direction would be cool. But, like _completely_ different. :)
I still like Slayer though, despite and thanks to the resemblance it holds towards the classic skin, in a way, and I'd probably buy it if I was a Jinx player. :)

Im curious about the other skin ideas that you guys were debating over.  Any chance you can give us some info on that?  Very curious indeed xD

they wont, riot doesnt like to give out information like that, especially with how people are reacting to these pretty bad harrowing themed skin if they told us another skin idea they had but scrapped and everyone thinks it was a great idea then the community will freak out.

We tend not to announce other potential ideas because they're not scrapped, but rather shelved. 

We've had instances where we've created skins, but kept them for later times. We did that with Guardian of the Sands Xerath, Rammus and Skarner. When they were originally created, we didn't feel it was the best time to release them, so we held off for about a year, and then released them when we were doing more Shurima-related content. 

That said, there are rare instances where we do scrap something because it just doesn't work out. If we said we had x concept and never released it, it'd be a shitty feeling if that concept was for your favorite champion and you were attached to it. D: 

Same would apply for if we said we had a concept for x skin, but we didn't plan to release it soon. It'd be unfair to say we had a concept, but we didn't want to say *when* we'd release it.

i agree with the logic behind it, i was just explaining to him that you guys wouldnt give out information like that because like you said say you scrapped or held off on pulsefire lee sin id feel sad. id rather not know you had the idea.
So there is no chance Lissandra is getting a new skin this year ? cause she was a great model for Halloween , and she cant get one snowy christmas skin cause her base model is already ice ...

*(Replying here as well)*

We don't have plans to give her a Halloween-esque themed skin this year.

Thanks for answering twice , you are really kind ^_^ Lissandra is my main i was waiting for a new skin of her and i really expected a halloween one , guess i'll just have to wait more and see what is planned for my witch !

If you wanted to slap a chainsaw onto a stick adn give it to Pantheon, it should have been a Space Marine / Warhammer style skin, especially with the mandrop and jetpack stuff.
